review_title: Colorado School of Mines is a great place to work - colleagues and students are amazing!
pros: Students are amazingly smart and eager to learn. Colleagues are helpful and supportive. Executive leadership cares about employees and students. They know your name, are open to new ideas, have a vision for the school and care about mental health and employee/student well-being. They were fiscally smart and didn't have to lay anybody off through the pandemic. Executive leadership made themselves take furlough days to save money, but nobody else at the school had to do that. Impressive!
cons: As a state school, they may not be able to pay what private industry does, but the tuition benefits, the high quality fully-paid health insurance plan and other benefits more than makes up for that.

pros: The faculty in the Geophysics Department is incredible. I would highly recommend the department to any prospective students.
cons: The Non-Thesis program does not include a paid stipend. If funding is essential, consider the Thesis Track or PhD options.

review_title: Student at CO School of Mines
pros:
-Quality education
-Research based
-Hands on experience

review_title: Excellent place to work and study
job_title: Graduate Teaching Assistant in Golden, CO
pros: As a current graduate student, working as a teaching assistant has been an excellent opportunity to supplement my education with involvement in the teaching process. Furthermore, working hours are flexible and not strictly adhered to, making for a adaptable and helpful studying environment.  Most, if not all professors understand that you are there to study first and work when possible.  Stipends are also quite high for the level of work performed.
cons: Teaching assistants are generally not much more than glorified admins and substitutes.  The work can be tedious, especially when grading 100+ undergraduate papers when you should be focused on your thesis.

pros: The views are great. And there random neat perks.
cons: People get entrenched and fight for power and control of stupid things. New ideas don't get to go far because someone higher up didn't think of it. Mines is notorious for lowballing people and not paying equal pay compared to other front range higher ed. People still use triplicate carbonless paper. AT A TECH BASED SCHOOL! People say Mines has an unofficial motto: "Colorado School of Mines: proudly marching into the 20th century!"

job_title: Design Lab & Machine Shop in Golden, CO
pros: Sometimes there's enough downtime to do homework, depending on where on campus you're working. Also you get to make a few friends on campus who come in as regulars.
cons: Not too many serious cons. Pay could definitely be better as it typically starts at $10/hr. Often you're locked in to whatever pay rate they set you at initially, and they won't raise it unless you ask. The higher your payrate, the less hours you work because the typical workstudy amount is about $2000 for the year.

pros: Hours,  Many of the faculty were easy to work with. Most of the students are understanding.   If you needed to be in the area they were o to let you do your job.
cons: The hierarchy of the Facilities Management are more concerned about office politics than their employees. Instead of running a facility like they wanted work done correctly. They were more concerned about if anyone was offending anyone else. A true PC witch hunt with more of a "don't say anything" or your likely to be fired atmosphere than of a higher education facility.

review_title: Being a Research Assistant in the Physics Department has broadened my knowledge exponentially.
pros: I love that my projects are self led, I am in charge of designing in SolidWorks and getting something built.  I have gained valuable experience in a field that I never thought would be something I would be interested in.  Everyone in the workplace is very nice and always willing to lend a hand.
cons: It has been a bit challenging to balance working 20-30 hours a week in addition to attending full time (15 credites) school (I am finishing up my Bachelors in Mechanical Engineering).

review_title: Good educational experience.  Great location at the foot of the Rockies!
pros: Good education.  Professors are actively engaged in research.  Strong ties with industry and other universities and government labs in Colorado.  Lots of contacts in Colorado.
cons: Small school so there is a limited amount of resources.  You have to really look around and develop your sleuthing abilities to discover what is available to you as a researcher.  Some of the school's overall management philosophy is a bit outdated.

review_title: Great Organization with Clear Mission to Serve Students
pros: The atmosphere here at Colorado School of Mines is one of dedication, innovation, and hard work...reflective of the kind of students who choose to be here.  They give their best and so we also give our best.  The students are smart, but also caring and clever...enjoyable to be around and appreciative of the support they get from staff.
cons: Gotta love the mission; most satisfying when contributing to the overall goals of the school.

review_title: Furthers my education, but certainly has drawbacks
job_title: Graduate Teaching Assistant in Golden, CO
pros: As a graduate student you will be getting an advanced degree, which is beneficial.  Besides classes and teaching your schedule is usually very flexible.
cons: Your adviser can be hit or miss, and they are the ones that shape your time here.  Salaries are low, especially since Golden is fairly expensive, but you are doing it for the degree and not the compensation.

review_title: The experience was useful, but felt fairly repetitive.
pros: The people are great and I am able to learn a lot from the work. The work does help you to develop the mindset of a researcher and asking the important questions.
cons: Sometimes the research meetings run longer that you would like while you are doing some time sensitive experiments. Also there are days where you aren't able to do much because the instruments need time to run the sample.

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Golden, CO
pros: Prestige of university and education. Lots of industry contacts and great professors, especially for those interested in academic research. Beautiful campus
cons: Terrible parking, increasingly poor administration management - seems they're only interested in profiting off of entering as many students as possible, despite physical and faculty limitations; lack of diversity or emphasis on promoting diversity; expensive and high cost of living, terrible mental health resources and a poor campus culture that results in many students struggling with mental health. You should be ready to work hard and long to get a graduate degree from Mines.

review_title: High Quality Academic Setting with Great Future Prospects
job_title: Graduate Teaching Assistant in Golden, CO
pros: Top Notch Academic Institution at a Small Campus Environment. World Class Professors.
cons: Too geared to Engineering, Could strengthen liberal arts related to sustainability, mining, resources, resource management, resource policy, resource law etc...Hence the library could be improved for Liberal Arts subjects.

review_title: Great place to work with a few minor caveats
pros: The people that work here are friendly and generally great to work with. Benefits package is probably better than most. Average vacation and holidays.
cons: Salary compensation is not top of class. New hires are tough to get approved so work load can be heavy. Raises in the classified system are nearly nonexistent.

pros: Stable office environment, with great coworkers. Other departmental staff were hard to work with, but my favorite part of working at Mines was my team. You will encounter a wide range of staff members there - but most work hard to make the student experience enjoyable.
cons: Work-life balance was not good. Transparent communication was often lacking when large roles were shifting. There was sometimes lack of trust and micro managing by upper management. Pay is average.

review_title: Just a grad student's perspective so far...
job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Golden, CO
pros: One of a kind research opportunity to work in an environment where the entire university is finding solutions to global energy and resource problems. There is no other place on Earth like CSM where people are working to solve these pressing issues at the this level of intensity and commitment.
cons: There could be more collaboration going on between departments. Often the work that goes on within one's own department is so time demanding that the rest of the university is almost forgotten.

pros: The people at Mines; staff and students are there to help each other.  The campus is beautiful and we'll kept.
cons: You pay for a parking pass and there is a waiting list for a dedicated parking space.  Your walk could be 10+ min into the office.

pros: This is a great place to work.  Great location, friendly atmosphere.  Committed to learning in all aspects.  All of the people who work here are committed to student excellence and work together to that end.  The students are valued and receive a great education.
cons: As student population grows, responsibilities increase with compensation increases not keeping up with the cost of living increases

review_title: Great place to be a research assistant.
job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Golden, CO
pros: Top-notch programs in engineering disciplines related to Earth, energy, and environment.  Incorporates real-life problems into the coursework and projects. Small/medium class sizes and great student/faculty ratio allows you to really get to know your professors.
cons: Everyone is an engineer. Need more hands-on work in the freshman and sophomore classes. It seems like in the last few years they have really been improving on this and incorporating more and more real-life, hands-on projects.

pros: From the beginning, I felt very welcome in my department and at the school.  I have been encouraged to be involved in professional development and Mines activities.  I enjoy the opportunity to work independently as well as a team.  Appreciate the great benefits as well.
cons: Getting started there are many different systems to learn and navigate which was a bit challenging.  There seems to be an improvement, however, it making the systems more streamlined.

pros:
-Flexible hours
-High pay for college job
-Great boss
-Currently expanding the program (through CASA) to help integrate more students who need extended time
cons:
-Short notice on scheduled hours
-Not typical 8am-5pm hours (sometimes as early as 6:30am and as late as midnight) -- but completely up to employee's own willingness to work these hours

pros: My adviser is outgoing, knowledgeable, and always there for guidance. Co-workers are easy going, fun and dedicated. Great work atmosphere.
cons: Occasionally, near deadlines, the work load can be overwhelming and stress levels can be tangible. However, this does not affect working relationships. Not really a con. Just a fact.

pros: They have flexible hours that fit nicely around student schedules and it is a friendly environment with a hard working team.
cons: As work study positions go, it is pretty decent work but it is not long term work unless one is looking to go into admissions after graduation.

pros: Spectacular location. Some labs have very advanced equipment and research projects.
cons: The culture is not great and administration is quite disorganized. They have a huge interest in selling the "Mines" brand and marketing, but not as much interest in improving the quality of education. There ARE some faculty who wish to change things, but it seems everyone is always fighting the conservative administration.

review_title: Colorado School of Mines is a good school for petroleum and chemical engineering.
job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Fountain Valley, CA
pros: Smaller school so better interpersonal relations. Its close to the mountains, so great things to do outside school on weekends. The career center facilities are very good.
cons: Not too many opportunities for majors other than petroleum, mining and chemical engineers. All research is geared toward geology and geophysics. Very less focus on other branches of science.

pros: I work in a lab as a student for a funded PHD student. I have flexible hours, and am able to easily integrate it into my school schedule. I have become a part of the team and I happy at my job
cons: The lab space is less than perfect, especially for what we are working on. I don't believe it is a health threatening situation however.

review_title: It was a great first job
job_title: Research Assistant in Citrus Heights, CA
pros: Hands-on experience, working with professionals
cons: Diversity, not enough opportunities for international students.

pros: Gave me the opportunity to research during my undergraduate degree
cons: Failed to provide me with the time to seek industry experience between terms

pros: Being a college, work experiences are going to depend on your department and who you work for. I had a great boss. The benefits are quite good as was the salary for a postdoc. Would've stayed forever if possible. Work schedules are as flexible as is possible.
cons: My position was temporary. Research community is small compared to larger universities.

pros: decent pay for students, flexible hours, good support network, helps to solidify personal knowledge of subject matter
cons: No real downsides other than the work comes and goes with the class. Some weeks there would be plenty and others none.

review_title: Highly Recommend Research Positions at CSM
pros: Very rewarding work for the length of my position with the school. Good mentoring from fellow professors and engaged student body.
cons: The school became much more top heavy with overhead for the administration over my time there. I could see a growing bureaucracy within the school that didn't seem to be efficient for internal governance.

review_title: Very nice place to work and live. Small school but lot of interaction among students and faculty
pros: Nice place to start your career with great faculty input along with lot of focus on interdisplinary projects and cutting edge research.
cons: It is a small school with mostly engineering courses and less of other disciplines like Management. Don't get too much exposure.

pros:
Allowed me to work on homework while working. 
Laid back 
The requirements were as simple as showing up and helping fellow students
cons:
There was no reward for working hard. 
Schedules were consistent and changing hours for emergencies was difficult. 
There is a general feeling of people not caring about their work/ just there to get paid.

pros: I got paid to grade other students it was great
cons: The teachers don't care about the students grades enough and what they are actually learning versus what they aren't.

review_title: I'm not sure what you want here?
job_title: Writing Center Consultant in Golden, CO
pros: Great educational institution.  I loved my job and was able to assist smart people from all over the world and also worked with wonderful colleagues.
cons: It was hard to find a parking place near campus as I didn't want to pay the fee to park in the closer parking lots.

review_title: Educational and supportive while taking undergraduate courses at CSM.
pros: Working on campus meant that there was always someone around if you needed help or advice, and employers are willing to work around your school schedule.
cons: It can be difficult to work on campus while attending school, and some employers require you to work during finals.

pros: Working at mines allowed me to grow as a researcher. Most of the faculty is very helpful and were willing to give me direction.
cons: There is not as much focus on teaching which makes it difficult if a student is trying to get a position in academia. Mostly focused on R&D and industry.

pros: The students are extremely bright, interesting, and fun to teach. The faculty and staff community is pretty close-knit. And Golden itself is a beautiful place to live and work.
cons: Adjunct faculty are not paid enough for their hard work. They also should be more integrated into the broader community.

review_title: Office Assistant in Capital Planning and Construction
job_title: Office Assistant In Capital Planning and Construction in Golden, CO
pros: Care about you and the work you do.  Put school first, never make you work when you have a test or ar swamped with HW.
cons: Was required more than initial Job description without pay increase.

job_title: Academic Computing Student Consultant in Golden, CO
pros: Flexible work schedule, great management, opportunity to learn more about computers, help out fellow classmates
cons: Sometimes limited hours, can be repetitive. Depending on the who you are working. Some other employees are great and others will want to shift all the work on you

pros: Flexibility for class schedule, have time to work on homework as well depending on how busy the office is. Base pay is okay, definitely more for spending money.
cons: A lot of the on campus jobs at school require you to have work study in order to apply for the job.

review_title: Good place to work as a student, great benefits included.
job_title: Assistant Chef De Projet Stockage D'énergie in Golden, CO
pros: It is a small school where you get to know everybody. It is especially good if you are a student.
cons: At times the hours can be excessive, and if you are a student there you will find that can be hard at times.

review_title: An amazing school that provides opportunity after opportunity
pros:
-Regarded as one of the best engineering schools in the nation 
-Excellent professors and staff to help you along the way
-Great industry connections
cons: -It is a very rigorous school and has that reputation for having the best students for a reason-it is hard.

pros: I had a pretty good time being a teaching assistant for one of the course labs required for my major. I liked mentoring the lower classmen and the workload was not bad at all. It kept me busy and earned some pocket change.
cons: Grading becomes tedious after awhile.

job_title: Undergraduate Research Assistant in Golden, CO
pros: All co-workers are really hardworking, the facilities are well equipped and the equipments are really modern. The career center is really helpful
cons: I really liked the school so the only thing that I have as a con is that it Could offer more opportunities for international students.

pros: Excellent School.  Small Classes.  Exceptional Location
cons: Too set in its ways and tradition.  For a small-size school it lacks flexibility

review_title: Graduate study experience at the Colorado School of Mines
job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Golden, CO
pros: The school is an engineering school with great university services due to its small size. Great connections between the school and industry. The location is also very good with great outdoor opportunities.
cons: There is not too much except engineering.

pros: Supportive, competent, and caring supervisors and colleagues. Great students. Campus setting in beautiful Golden, Colorado. Freedom to work both independently and collaboratively. Excellent retirement, healthcare benefits, and paid time off.
cons: Housing near campus is not very affordable. Three-year vesting period on employer-contributed retirement benefits.

review_title: Limited Opportunities Shrinking for State Employees
pros: Excellent benefit package and balance of work life.  Great location and community.
cons: Limited to non existant opportunities for professional growth or promotion due to the restrictive state rules surrounding hiring practices of classified employees.

review_title: Great People, Good Job Skills Learned
job_title: Student Caller W/Foundation in Golden, CO
pros: Good pay, straightforward job, opportunities for networking, people are willing to talk and help you improve, coworkers are friendly enough
cons: Odd hours, tough to get raises, apart from that not much else I can say, but Glassdoor wants 20 words

job_title: Undergraduate Research Assistant in Golden, CO
pros: Hands on lab experience working and learning about chemical synthesis, lab SOP and etiquette
cons: Sometimes the Supervisors were so busy with the required classes they had to teach that it would slow down advancement in research.

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Golden, CO
pros: Good environment. Small campus. Friendly people. Near downtown and creek.
cons: No party place around.  Little difficult on winter for people coming from the hot and humid place.

review_title: The job was easy and didn't require any hard work. Worked part time while also being a student there.
pros:
Easy work to make extra money while attending school
Flexible schedule 
Doing something different every day 
Easy to learn quickly
cons: Pay was pretty much minimum wage

job_title: Front Desk Assistant in Golden, CO
pros: It's great to be connected to professors within your department. It's a nice break from school that allows you to make some extra money while still in school.
cons: You're not really able to do homework while you're on the job.

review_title: If you can, Go for it
pros: Its a pretty easy source of income to manage and can act as a great refresher for older material.
cons: It can get stressful if you take on more work than you can handle. Mind your limits.

job_title: Postdoctoral Research Associate in Golden, CO
pros: Really good benefits, good pay. Biggest plus is the place. Golden is one of the most beautiful places to be.
cons: I have not encountered a single Con in my 2 years working here.

job_title: Graduate Research/Teaching Assistant in Golden, CO
pros: the location, supervisors experience, and connection to industry were a plus
cons: Like many modern universities, work in the mining and mineral processing are less and less attractive when attending the GRAD conference held on campus annualy

review_title: Supportive Environment and Employees Are Appreciated
pros: It is a great place to work because the campus beautiful. Employees collaborate well and it is an inclusive environment.
cons: All is great so far.

review_title: a small public teaching and research university in Golden, Colorado, devoted to engineering and applied science, with sp

pros: Good reputation, high starting salary for graduates
cons: small campus, some times it needs to share the court

job_title: Graduate Teaching Assistant in Golden, CO
pros: Interesting projects and people who care about the work.
cons: Professors dont have too much respect for your time.

pros: Knowledgable faculty and top level research.  Golden is a great town with quick access to the Colorado mountains.
cons: Some buildings and facilities were becoming outdated depending on department.

pros: It's a lot of fun and you get to help students learn physics II!
cons: Grading after the tests can go late into the night.

review_title: Not a Bad Way to Get Through Undergrad
pros: Flexible hours, supportive teaching faculty, good work environment, transparent communication between professors and TAs.
cons: Minimum wage/barely above minimum wage, occasional issues with aging equipment.

pros: Flexible working hours and help students have less student loans at the end
cons: Low pay. Faculty and students can use a better pay

pros: supportive culture, fascinating research, motivated students with strong faculty support
cons: dated systems but improving every day, cap on administrative salaries

pros: Great environment, steady work, fairly relaxed.
cons: No flex time, low pay, little chance for advancement.

review_title: Great Fun Working at the Library

pros: As a student worker it was great to work at the front desk, meet new people and help.

review_title: Awesome experience with lots of room to grow
pros: Access to rentals and tools, along with knowledgeable people to teach you new things
cons: Pay is not very competitive

review_title: Great Place to work and go to school!
pros: Great atmosphere. Bosses understand if you have schoolwork priorities.
cons: None at this point in time. It is a very laid back environment.

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Golden, CO
pros: Good pay, flexible work schedule, great supervisor, and rewarding work.

The staff are really nice and supportive

cons: I have none, has treated well for past two years.

pros: Amazing benefits. Great work environment. Awesome people!
cons: Golden is expensive. Salaries struggle to keep up with the rapidly increasing cost of living.

pros: Its fulfilling hands on work

review_title: Good place to work if you are a student

pros: Everyone understood that working as a student came first above working at the library. Flexible hours.
